answers.answer: Personally I found walking in a pool did wonders for swelling. Or sitting my feet on cold water. It is recommended that you elevate your feet when swollen and drink lots of water to help with fluid retention.Personally I found exercise helped with both of these issues but it depends how bad your feet are swelling, it may be too uncomfortable for you. Sudden swelling can be a symptom of preeclampsia as well so it might be worth mentioning it to your doctor. Best of luck

I had really bad swelling with my first but I've been a lot more active with this pregnancy and it has helped a lot. I am 39weeks. My chiropractor said circulation helps and ive found i have less swelling on the days i do stretches then when i dont
Thankyou ladies I will do whatever I can to help my swelling
oh those two things are fir exactly the same reason... salt!!!!!!! no more salt ;)
I am trying my best to eat less salt now that I know that's the problem
I wanna thankyou all for commenting really means alot the advices I am receiving from all of you I really appreciate it :)

question: Well all through my pregnancy I didn't have swollen feet till now that im 38weeks oh and I'm also retaining fluids. What can I do to stop the swelling and retaining of fluids?  Help please
title: ladies help please
